owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Iker Esnaola-Gonzalez <mailto:iker.esnaola@tekniker.es> Jesús Bermúdez <mailto:jesus.bermudez@ehu.eus>
owl:Ontology.terms:description: EEPSA (Energy Efficiency Prediction Semantic Assistant) Ontology aims to capture knowledge related to buildings, sensing and actuating devices, and their corresponding observations and actuations, towards the support of data analysts in energy efficiency problems.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: EEPSA (Energy Efficiency Prediction Semantic Assistant) Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Information about changes compared to version 1.2 ********************************************************* • The classes and properties related to the building modelling (imported from bim4EEPSA) are now described using the BOT Ontology. • The f4EEPSA (Forecasting for EEPSA) module is now imported.

The ontology is documented in:
Iker Esnaola-Gonzalez, Jesús Bermúdez, Izaskun Fernandez, Aitor Arnaiz, (2018) Semantic Prediction Assistant Approach applied to Energy Efficiency in Tertiary Buildings http://www.semantic-web-journal.net/content/semantic-prediction-assistant-approach-applied-energy-efficiency-tertiary-buildings-1

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: A location not provided by geo-coordinates (i.e. building A, city of Aarhus).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an Observation and the Spatial Thing (Building, Space) where it has been captured
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: captured in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Spatial Thing (Building, Space) and the Observation that has been captured
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: captures

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Thing and a data source where values can be retrieved.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has data source

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a Thing (mainly an Outlier) and a Procedure proposed to solve it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has solving method

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the period to which it is exposed to sun
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sun exposure period

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a space and the Quantity Kind that is affects its indoor conditions
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is affected by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property that links a Thing, with a Situation that is forecasted to produce
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is forecasted to produce situation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship between a space and the Quantity Kind that is affects its indoor conditions with a higher degree
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is highly affected by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Weather Station and the Weather Service it provides (weather report, weather forecast,...)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: provides weather service

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Ending Time of a temporal entity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: ending time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Determines the Starting time of a temporal entity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: starting time

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space in contact with the exterior by means of at least one building element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Adjacent to Outdoor Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space with bad insulation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bad Insulated Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space located in a storey below ground.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Below Ground Level Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A set of circumstances that ensures a comfortable thermal situation. Themal comfort is understood as that condition of mind that express satisfaction with the thermal environment and is assessed by subjective evaluation. (Source: ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 55-2017)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Comfortable Thermal Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A situation that meets themal requirements defined by UK's HSE (Health and Safety Execution) guidelines.
Temperatures over 16ºC during working hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HSE Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A situation that meets themal requirements defined by Spanish INSHT (Instituto Nacional de Seguridad e Higiene en el Trabajo) guidelines for light workplaces.
Temperatures between 14ºC and 25ºC during working hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: INSHT for Light Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A situation that meets themal requirements defined by Spanish INSHT (Instituto Nacional de Seguridad e Higiene en el Trabajo) guidelines for sedentary workplaces.
Temperatures between 17ºC and 27ºC during working hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: INSHT for Sedentary Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Properties that can be measured by weather stations.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Meteorological Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space enlightened with a source of light from the exterior (and not enlightened by a source of light inside the space).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Naturally Enlightened Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the North West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: North West Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A situation that meets themal requirements defined by Spanish RITE (Reglamento de Instalaciones Térmicas en los Edificios) guidelines for Winter days.
Temperatures between 21ºC and 23ºC during working hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RITE for Winter Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A situation that meets themal requirements defined by Spanish RITE (Reglamento de Instalaciones Térmicas en los Edificios) guidelines for Summer days.
Temperatures between 23ºC and 25ºC during working hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RITE for Summer Situation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South East
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South East Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the South West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: South West Oriented Object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: HVAC control strategies that fulfill a set of regulations and guidelines that ensure occupants' comfort with the thermal environment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Thermal Comfort Regulation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Meteorological conditions' forecast for a specific area and time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weather Forecasting

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A summary of meteorological conditions for a specific area and time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weather Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A service providing weather forecasts, warnings of hazardous weather, and other weather-related products to organizations and the public for the purposes of protection, safety, and general information
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weather Service

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Object oriented towards the West
owl:Class.rdfs:label: West Oriented Object

rdf:Description.dc:description: A vocabulary for representing latitude, longitude and altitude information in the WGS84 geodetic reference datum. Version $Id: wgs84_pos.rdf,v 1.22 2009/04/20 15:00:30 timbl Exp $. See http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/ for more details.
rdf:Description.dc:title: WGS84 Geo Positioning: an RDF vocabulary
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Recent changes to this namespace: $Log: wgs84_pos.rdf,v $ Revision 1.22 2009/04/20 15:00:30 timbl Remove the time bits which have been deal with elsewhere eg in iCal.
Revision 1.21 2009/04/20 12:52:47 timbl try again
Revision 1.20 2009/04/20 12:42:11 timbl Add Event (edited ages ago and never checked in), and location (following discussion http://chatlogs.planetrdf.com/swig/2009-04-20#T12-36-09)
Revision 1.19 2009/04/20 12:36:31 timbl Add Event (edited ages ago and never checked in), and location (following discussion http://chatlogs.planetrdf.com/swig/2009-04-20#T12-36-09)
Revision 1.18 2006/02/01 22:01:04 danbri Clarified that lat and long are decimal degrees, and that alt is decimal metres about local reference ellipsoid
Revision 1.17 2004/02/06 17:38:12 danbri Fixed a bad commit screwup
Revision 1.15 2003/04/19 11:24:08 danbri Fixed the typo even more.
Revision 1.14 2003/04/19 11:16:56 danbri fixed a typo
Revision 1.13 2003/02/19 22:27:27 connolly relaxed domain constraints on lat/long/alt from Point to SpatialThing
Revision 1.12 2003/01/12 01:41:41 danbri Trying local copy of XSLT doc.
Revision 1.11 2003/01/12 01:20:18 danbri added a link to morten's xslt rdfs viewer.
Revision 1.10 2003/01/11 18:56:49 danbri Removed datatype range from lat and long properties, since they would have required each occurance of the property to mention the datatype.
Revision 1.9 2003/01/11 11:41:31 danbri Another typo; repaired rdfs:Property to rdf:Property x4
Revision 1.8 2003/01/11 11:05:02 danbri Added an rdfs:range for each lat/long/alt property, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float
Revision 1.7 2003/01/10 20:25:16 danbri Longer rdfs:comment for Point, trying to be Earth-centric and neutral about coordinate system(s) at the same time. Feedback welcomed.
Revision 1.6 2003/01/10 20:18:30 danbri Added CVS log comments into the RDF/XML as an rdfs:comment property of the vocabulary. Note that this is not common practice (but seems both harmless and potentially useful).
revision 1.5 date: 2003/01/10 20:14:31; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +16 -5 Updated schema: Added a dc:date, added url for more info. Changed the rdfs:label of the namespace from gp to geo. Added a class Point, set as the rdfs:domain of each property. Added XML comment on the lat_long property suggesting that we might not need it (based on #rdfig commentary from implementors).
revision 1.4 date: 2003/01/10 20:01:07; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +6 -5 Fixed typo; several rdfs:about attributes are now rdf:about. Thanks to MortenF in #rdfig for catching this error.
revision 1.3 date: 2003/01/10 11:59:03; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +4 -3 fixed buglet in vocab, added more wgs links
revision 1.2 date: 2003/01/10 11:01:11; author: danbri; state: Exp; lines: +4 -4 Removed alt from the as-a-flat-string property, and switched from space separated to comma separated.
revision 1.1 date: 2003/01/10 10:53:23; author: danbri; state: Exp; basic geo vocab
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: geo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A comma-separated representation of a latitude, longitude coordinate.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lat/long
